column2: Longitudinal Quality of Life Study Among Participants with AIDS-Associated Kaposi Sarcoma at Bugando Medical Centre, in Mwanza, Tanzania
This protocol will be open at the Bugando Medical Centre in Mwanza, Tanzania
Participants with KS who are HIV-positive initiating chemotherapy with bleomycin and vincristine sulfate (BV). See Section 3.0 for eligibility criteria.

Participants will receive standard therapy for KS: bleomycin (15 units/m2) and vincristine (2mg fixed dose) infused intravenously every 21 days for a maximum of six cycles. A Quality of Life (QOL) survey, the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-General (FACT-G), will be administered at baseline, after 3 and 6 cycles of treatment (cycle 4 and treatment discontinuation), and at 3 months after treatment discontinuation.
To evaluate the longitudinal quality of life of participants with HIV-associated KS during treatment with vincristine and bleomycin at a single institution in East Africa.
To explore baseline and time-dependent correlates of improvements in quality of life.
To assess quality control (completeness and accuracy) in data capture of adverse events, clinical benefit, and objective response for site evaluation and training purposes.
